statement: I’m usually the one who keeps the group chat alive.
I’d rather have a "rotting day" in bed than go to a party.
I have no problem being the "main character" in a crowded room.
I need significant "me-time" to recharge after social events.
I often start conversations with strangers or baristas.
I genuinely enjoy helping my friends, even if it's inconvenient.
I tend to point out when people are wrong, even if it causes tension.
I’m the "mom/dad" of the group who makes sure everyone is okay.
I believe most people are mostly looking out for themselves.
I’m quick to forgive when someone gives me a "half-baked" apology.
I have my week planned out in a digital calendar or planner.
I often find myself "doomscrolling" instead of doing my tasks.
I’m the person who actually reads the fine print and instructions.
My workspace is a chaotic mess that I’ll "clean eventually."
I finish my work well before the actual deadline.
I often overthink a text message for hours after sending it.
I stay pretty chill even when everything is going wrong.
I get "hangry" or irritable quite easily when stressed.
I rarely feel targeted or offended by what others say.
My mood can change based on a single "off" interaction.
I’m always down to try a weird new food trend or hobby.
I prefer sticking to the same "comfort" shows and routines.
I love thinking about deep or abstract "what if" ideas.
I’m not really into art, poetry, or "deep" museum vibes.
I love finding music that sounds completely different
